response: "I can't keep up with everyone's expectations. It's like I'm constantly drowning in this pressure to be flawless."
"Why does everyone expect me to be perfect? It's like I'm not allowed to have any flaws or make any mistakes."
"I feel like I'm losing touch with reality. The constant need to be perfect is driving me crazy."
"I don't even know who I am anymore. Society's standards have taken over my identity, and I'm struggling to find myself again."
"Every time I look in the mirror, I see all the imperfections that society tells me I need to fix. It's exhausting and overwhelming."
"I can't help but question if I'll ever be good enough. No matter how hard I try, it seems like perfection is always just out of reach."
"The pressure to be perfect is suffocating. It's like I'm trapped in a never-ending cycle of self-doubt and self-criticism."
"I wish I could escape the constant judgment and scrutiny. It feels like society's expectations are driving me to the brink of insanity."
"I feel like I'm living in a distorted reality where everyone else has it all figured out, and I'm just struggling to keep up."
"I'm starting to realize that perfection is an illusion. It's time to let go of society's expectations and focus on finding happiness and acceptance within myself."
